![Gungmangbong Recreational Forest (Pocheon) (Íµ≠ÎßùÎ¥âÏûêÏó∞Ìú¥ÏñëÎ¶º (Ìè¨Ï≤ú))](/2022-08-25-1661403617108/219076_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > Gungmangbong Recreational Forest is situated to the west of Sillobong Peak and Gukmangbong Peak. Within the recreation forest there are around 170 kinds of plants including nut pine trees, pine trees, and others. Visitors can enjoy with cool valley in summer and the beautiful snowy landscape of the mountains in winter. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|‚Ä¢ 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)
‚Ä¢ For more info: +82-10-2234-5522| |opendate:|July 1, 1999| |usetime:|[General admission] 08:00-18:00
[Accommodations] Check-in 14:00 / Check-out 11:00 (next day)| ## Detail Info | | | | - | - | |Hiking Course:|Idong-myeon Office - Jangam Reservoir - East Valley - Crossroad - Summit - Northern mountain range - T-intersection - Jangam Reservoir - Idong-myeon Office (15 km, 5 hr 30 min)| |Film Locations:|Dramas "My Daughter Seoyoung (2012)," ‚ÄòMy Love from the Star (2013)," "Inspiring Generation (2014)," etc.| |Facility Utilization Fees:|[Log cabin]
4 people (1 vehicle): 100,000~120,000 won
6 people (2 vehicles): 150,000~180,000 won
8 people (3 vehicles): 200,000~250,000 won

[Camping]
Basic option (2 adults + 2 children + 1 parking space): 70,000~80,000 won
* Extra charge of 10,000 per additional person/parking space| |Available Facilities:|Lakeside House, barbecue grill, walking path, forest bathing, hiking path, nature observation, forest learning center, sports field, playground, etc.| |Admission Fees:|General admission 5,000 won/ Hikers 2,000 won
* Accommodation rates for log cabin and camping fees are included in admission fees| |Restrooms:|Available| ## Detail Image ![/2022-08-25-1661403617108/219071_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-25-1661403617108/219071_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-25-1661403617108/219072_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-25-1661403617108/219072_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-25-1661403617108/219074_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-25-1661403617108/219074_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-25-1661403617108/219075_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-25-1661403617108/219075_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-25-1661403617108/219077_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-25-1661403617108/219077_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-25-1661403617108/219359_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-25-1661403617108/219359_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-25-1661403617108/219360_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-25-1661403617108/219360_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [‚òéÔ∏è+82-10-2234-5522](tel:+821022345522) - [üè†www.kookmang.co.kr](http://www.kookmang.co.kr) ```googleMap latitude: 38.0288913418 longitude: 127.3962195284 title: 207-28, Neumbawi-gil, Pocheon-si, Gyeonggi-do ``` ## Directions [Bus + Taxi]
From Dong Seoul Bus Terminal, take the intercity bus to I-dong Bus Stop.
From I-dong Bus Stop, take a taxi to the recreational forest.

data.title: Gungmangbong Recreational Forest (Pocheon) (Íµ≠ÎßùÎ¥âÏûêÏó∞Ìú¥ÏñëÎ¶º (Ìè¨Ï≤ú))
data.description: Gungmangbong Recreational Forest is situated to the west of Sillobong Peak and Gukmangbong Peak. Within the recreation forest there are around 170 kinds of plants including nut pine trees, pine trees, and others. Visitors can enjoy with cool valley in summer and the beautiful snowy landscape of the mountains in winter.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Jatyanggi Purunsup Resort (Ïû£Ìñ•Í∏∞Ìë∏Î•∏Ïà≤)
dataList.description: Located in Gyeonggi-do and home to the nation's largest nut pine forest, composed of trees over 80 years old, Jatyanggi Purunsup Resort is a special recreational forest complex where phytoncide emitted from the pine tree forest creates a healing experience. The forest is located between 450 and 600 meters above sea level on Chungnyeongsan and Seorisan Mountains.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Jarasum Island (ÏûêÎùºÏÑ¨)
dataList.description: Located in Gapyeong, Gyeonggi-do, Jarasum Island is an island formed on the Bukhangang River as a result of the construction of the Cheongpyeong Dam in 1943. The name ‘Jarasum’ comes from the fact that it faces a hill that resembles a Jara (Korean word for soft-shelled turtle). Jarasum consists of four islands called Dongdo, Seodo, Jungdo, and Namdo, and has various leisure and park facilities. Visitors can find a car camping site and the filming location of the popular TV drama series 'Iris' on Seodo (west island), and an eco-cultural park with a grass plaza of over 100 meters in diameter on Jungdo (central island). There is also an ecosystem theme park called Ehwawon Garden at the westernmost tip of the Jarasum Campground. A popular camping spot, Jaraseom Island is also widely known as the venue of the annual Jarasum International Jazz Festival.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Jangja Lake Park (Ïû•ÏûêÌò∏ÏàòÍ≥µÏõê)
dataList.description:
Guri City worked to improve the water quality of Jangja Lake in order to form the Jangja Lake Park and in the process an ecological zone was created. A 3.6 km tree-lined walking trail runs through the park and is frequently used by people enjoying an outing or getting some light exercise. Concerts, exhibitions, and other events are held on the outdoor stage on weekends and the park is widely used as a place to relax by local residents.

* Size - Area 107,385 m¬≤, average water depth 2.2 m (0.2 m~4.7 m), and walkway 4.6 km
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Janganmun Gate (Ïû•ÏïàÎ¨∏)
dataList.description: Janganmun Gate is the main gate of Hwaseong Fortress at the northern wall. Jangan means capital, implying that Hwaseong Fortress is the secondary capital. Janganmun Gate served as the main gate because the king would pass from this gate when arriving from Hanyang, the capital city, now modern-day Seoul. It is interesting to note that this gate is larger than Sungryemun Gate in Seoul.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Imjingak Resort (ÌååÏ£º ÏûÑÏßÑÍ∞Å(ÌèâÌôîÎàÑÎ¶¨Í≥µÏõê))
dataList.description: Located approximately 56 kilometers from Seoul City Hall and 7 kilometers from DMZ, Imjingak is an important part of Korean history. Imjingak Resort has various war-related artifacts as well as spacious Pyeonghwa Nuri Park. The resort preserves the Freedom Bridge and Imjingang rail bridge from the Korean War to remind people of the past, along with a Memorial Hall, memorial monuments and recreational areas.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Ilyeong Herbland (ÏùºÏòÅÌóàÎ∏åÎûúÎìú)
dataList.description: Ilyeong Herbland offers picturesque scenery, combining both natural and man-made beauty with herbal gardens resting on a wide outdoor field. Ilyeong Herbland is comprised of an herbal botanical garden, herbal shop, well-being corner, restaurant, outdoor garden, and walking paths. Visitors can buy herbal plants and can also have various herbal teas and boiled rice with herbal flowers.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Ilsan Lake Park (ÏùºÏÇ∞Ìò∏ÏàòÍ≥µÏõê)
dataList.description: Ilsan Lake Park spans over 991,800 square meters, making it one of the largest man-made parks in Asia. The large fresh water lake is well-managed to remain clean. The park is equipped with convenient facilities and attractions, including the Riverside Square, artificial islands, a 4.7-kilometer-long bike path, children‚Äôs playground, natural experience site, musical fountain, 100 species of wild flowers and a dense forest of 200,000 trees. The park also serves as the venue for International Horticulture Goyang Korea, a large flower exhibition.
dataList.author: korea-tour
